shortlist.name: Lahinch Wave (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Strong recent form and favorable odds make it a top contender. Trainer Neil Mulholland has a good record with similar horses.

shortlist.name: Somespring Special (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form shows consistency and improvement. The partnership with Philip Hobbs & Johnson White adds strength.

shortlist.name: Kosasiempre (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: Form suggests potential for a strong run, and odds offer value compared to others in the field.

shortlist.name: Welcom To Cartries (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent form in competitive races, trained by Paul Nicholls (top strike rate at Chepstow), and partnered with leading jockey Harry Cobden. Recent form figures suggest reliability and ability at this level. Odds reflect strong market confidence and connections.

shortlist.name: Knight Of Allen (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with a win last time out and consistent placed efforts prior. Course winner (C in form), indicating suitability for Chepstow. Connections are reliable at this level. Odds offer value for a proven, in-form runner.

shortlist.name: Coco Mademoiselle (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent winning form (1-101) and trained by Dan Skelton, a trainer with a strong record in similar events. Harry Skelton is a top jockey booking. The horse is proven at this class and distance, and odds indicate market respect.

shortlist.name: Tarot
shortlist.rationale: Consistent placed form in all three starts, suggesting reliability and readiness to win. Trained by Roger Varian, a top yard, and partnered by Rossa Ryan, both in strong form. Market support is significant, indicating confidence from connections and punters. No need for major improvement to win this field.

shortlist.name: Albaydaa (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Debut third for William Haggas, a trainer with a high strike rate with second-time starters. The form is respectable and open to improvement, and the odds reflect strong market respect. Connections are notable and the horse is expected to progress without needing a major leap.

shortlist.name: Valdorcia (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Third on debut for Charlie Appleby, a trainer renowned for improving horses on their second start. The form is solid and the horse is likely to step forward. Market position is clear of outsiders, and the connections are top class.

shortlist.name: Wesam (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent win indicates strong form and confidence from connections.

shortlist.name: Oursin
shortlist.rationale: Consistent form and strong trainer/jockey combination.

shortlist.name: Bay Of Light
shortlist.rationale: Trainer reputation and decent odds make it a contender despite lack of recent form data.

shortlist.name: Waiting All Night
shortlist.rationale: Consistently running in competitive races and currently the market favourite, suggesting strong support. While not winning recently, form is solid and connections are capable. Likely to be in the mix based on odds and consistency.

shortlist.name: Absolute Star
shortlist.rationale: Recent win two starts ago and competitive form figures indicate reliability and fitness. Roger Varian is a top trainer, and Rossa Ryan is a strong jockey booking. Odds are fair for a horse with proven ability at this level.

shortlist.name: Daisy Roots
shortlist.rationale: Recent win last time out and another win four starts back show upward trajectory and fitness. Jim Boyle’s runners often improve for the all-weather surface, and odds offer reasonable value for a last-time winner.

shortlist.name: Kingmaker (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple placed efforts, suggesting he is knocking on the door. Trained by a top yard and ridden by a capable jockey. Odds represent solid value for a horse with proven competitiveness at this level.

shortlist.name: My Kinda Ghaiy (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent if unspectacular form, but has been running in competitive races. Trainer and jockey are reliable, and the odds are fair for a horse that rarely runs a bad race. Needs to find a bit more to win, but is a solid each-way proposition.

shortlist.name: Zarakerjack (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: Showed improved form last time out with a close second. If able to build on that, could be a major player. Trainer and jockey are in form. Odds are slightly generous for a horse with recent upward trajectory.

shortlist.name: Precise (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Outstanding recent form with three consecutive wins, top-class connections, and the shortest odds in the field indicate both public and professional confidence. Soumillon is a world-class jockey, and O'Brien excels with progressive types at Newmarket. No signs of decline in form, and the horse is peaking at the right time.

shortlist.name: Composing (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer with two wins and recent placings at a competitive level. Trained by O'Brien, suggesting strong preparation and reliability. Form is solid and the odds reflect genuine winning potential without being overbet. No major negatives in recent runs.

shortlist.name: Dance To The Music
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with two wins from three starts, trained by Appleby and ridden by Buick—both highly successful at Newmarket. The latest fourth can be forgiven given the horse's upward trajectory and potential for further improvement. Odds offer value for a runner with proven ability and elite connections.

shortlist.name: Falakeyah
shortlist.rationale: Recent winner showing peak form with a strong win last time out. Short odds reflect market confidence in current ability. Rodriguez/Burrows combination is reliable and the form line '1-19' shows recent victory after layoff, suggesting horse has returned to best.

shortlist.name: Sand Gazelle
shortlist.rationale: Pattern of consistency with two wins in last six starts including recent victory. Elite Gosden/Murphy partnership excels at this level. Form figures show horse is competitive in quality races. Second-favorite status offers potential value if building toward peak form.

shortlist.name: Miss Justice
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with two wins and multiple places demonstrating reliability. Gosden stable second runner suggests confidence. Doyle is a quality jockey booking. The '222115' pattern shows horse racing to its ability consistently and appears well handicapped at current odds.

shortlist.name: Hornsea Bay
shortlist.rationale: Market leader with strong local connections. O'Meara/Tudhope partnership excels at York. Recent form shows consistency with multiple placed efforts. Third in last start indicates current fitness.

shortlist.name: Jupiter Ammon (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Excellent recent form with four consecutive placed efforts including two seconds. Balding stable in-form. Progressive profile suggests ready to break through. Tight odds reflect market confidence.

shortlist.name: Dante's Lad (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Course winner with proven ability. Recent fifth acceptable after pull-up suggests bounce back possible. Boughey yard targeting this. Each-way value at current odds.

shortlist.name: Sands Of Spain (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent at this level, with recent wins and placings. Andrew Balding stable in good form, and P. J. McDonald is a top jockey. The form string shows ability to win and place, and the odds are fair for a horse with proven class.

shortlist.name: Clear Force (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form figures (2,1,4,0,3,2) indicate consistent competitiveness without a win, but always in the mix. K. R. Burke is a leading northern trainer, and the horse is clearly capable at this level. Odds represent solid each-way value.

shortlist.name: Utmost Respect (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Form includes a recent win and a close second, suggesting the horse is in good heart. Richard Fahey is a shrewd trainer, and Oisin Orr is a capable claimer. The odds are slightly inflated given the recent win, but the horse is a live contender.

shortlist.name: Kinswoman
shortlist.rationale: Progressive filly with two consecutive wins, indicating peak form. Trained by William Haggas, a top York handler, and partnered with Cieren Fallon. Recent form is strong and consistent, suggesting fitness and readiness. Odds reflect genuine market respect.

shortlist.name: Roach Power (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Arrives off back-to-back wins, showing clear improvement and adaptability. Consistent performer with a solid record at this level. Trainer and jockey have proven ability in competitive handicaps. Odds indicate strong market confidence.

shortlist.name: Eternal Sunshine
shortlist.rationale: Recent form features three wins and two placings from last five starts, demonstrating reliability and fitness. Trainer Jim Goldie is adept with sprinters, and the horse has shown versatility. Odds are fair for a runner with proven recent ability.

shortlist.name: Quest For Fun
shortlist.rationale: Recent form shows consistency with a couple of strong finishes, and the trainer-jockey combination is experienced. The odds offer good value for a contender with this level of form.

shortlist.name: Daring Legend
shortlist.rationale: Recent form includes a win and some promising places, suggesting potential for improvement. The odds are reasonable for a horse with this level of recent success.

shortlist.name: Vixey
shortlist.rationale: Consistent form figures indicate a strong contender. The horse has shown ability to perform well over similar distances and conditions.

shortlist.name: Kansas (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent, high-class form with multiple placed efforts in strong company. Trained by Ireland's leading stable, ridden by a top jockey. The only horse in the field with proven, repeated form at this level. Odds are short but justified by reliability and connections.

shortlist.name: Sirius A (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Solid recent form with a win and several placed efforts. Trainer and jockey are capable, and the horse is proven over the trip. Represents fair each-way value at current odds.

shortlist.name: Howd'yadoit (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with a recent win and consistent placed efforts. Trainer is in form, and the horse is unexposed at this level. Odds offer value for a horse on the up.

shortlist.name: Wegotogether (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form is solid for the grade, with a string of placed efforts. Gavin Patrick Cromwell is a leading trainer and G. F. Carroll is a reliable jockey. The horse is not obviously out of form and is respected at the weights. Odds are tight but reflect chance.

shortlist.name: Sierra De Gredos
shortlist.rationale: Consistent form with recent wins and places, including a strong second last time out. Ben Martin Coen is a top jockey and Andrew Oliver is a respected trainer. The horse is proven at this level and is not exposed as needing major improvement. Odds represent fair value for a horse with this profile.

shortlist.name: Venetian (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Form figures include a recent win and a close second, suggesting the horse is in good heart. The trainer/jockey combination is solid if not elite. Odds are generous for a horse with recent winning form and no obvious negatives.

shortlist.name: Sarmiento Power (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent win and strong odds suggest a high level of confidence in this runner's current form.

shortlist.name: Gallo Dell Cielo (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent form and decent odds make this horse a contender.

shortlist.name: Johnny's Oasis
shortlist.rationale: Recent form shows potential, and odds are favorable.

note: Filtered to top 3 profitable picks per race
